title: Add compiled CUDA version in torch.version
body_html:
It might be good to have the CUDA version that was used to compile pytorch included somewhere accessible via Python, without the need to have CUDA installed in the machine.

Currently, I believe there is no way to find which CUDA version was used to compile pytorch, and we need to rely on a runtime error that requires CUDA to run to know if the wheel is compatible.

I propose to add a cuda flag in torch.version that returns the CUDA version used to compile PyTorch.

What do you think?

body:
It might be good to have the CUDA version that was used to compile pytorch included somewhere accessible via Python, without the need to have CUDA installed in the machine.

Currently, I believe there is no way to find which CUDA version was used to compile pytorch, and we need to rely on a runtime error that [requires CUDA to run](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/cuda/__init__.py#L55) to know if the wheel is compatible.

I propose to add [a `cuda` flag in `torch.version`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/setup.py#L172) that returns the CUDA version used to compile PyTorch.

What do you think?
